temp
Class DisplayFrame

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          java.awt.Window
              java.awt.Frame
                  javax.swing.JFrame
                      temp.DisplayFrame
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants
public class DisplayFrame
extends javax.swing.JFrame

This is the main class that displays the GUI and has most of the code for displaying the graphs. Also contains action listeners and stuff

Author:
Jeff Falkenham, Summer 2008/Summer 2009
See Also:
Serialized Form

resizeCustomTextPane

public void resizeCustomTextPane()

displaySource

public void displaySource()
Displays the source code in the TextPane with the correct background color on each line

getMultiColorPaint

public java.awt.Paint getMultiColorPaint(float temp)
Calculates the color of the node. Uses red, yellow, and green, and does not vary the shade. Red if temp is less than 0.33333, yellow if temp is less than 0.6666666, and green otherwise.

Parameters:
temp - The percentage given by the getPercent() method in MutationData
Returns:
The color of the node

getRedPaint

public java.awt.Paint getRedPaint(float temp)
Gives the node a certain shade of red based on temp

Parameters:
temp - The percentage given by getPercent() in MutationData (float)
Returns:
The color of the node (Color)

getGreenPaint

public java.awt.Paint getGreenPaint(float temp)

Parameters:
temp - The percentage given by getPercent() in MutationData (float)
Returns:
The color of the node (Color)

getCustomPaint

public java.awt.Paint getCustomPaint(float temp)
Calculates the custom color. Red/green/blue are stored in rgbRed, rgbGreen, and rgbBlue. The percent ranges are stored in the range variable. eg: if range.get(0) is 40, then between 0 and 40, the color will be Color(rgbRed(0), rgbGreen(0), rgbBlue(0))

Parameters:
temp - The percentage given by getPercent() in MutationData (float)
Returns:
The color of the node (Color)

findLinePercent

public float findLinePercent(int line,
                             java.lang.String file)
Calculates the background color of a line of source code by averaging the getPercent() of the mutants associated with the line of source code. Doesn't actually return a color, but returns a the average of all the getPercent() values, which can be passed to the getPaintColor() method.

Parameters:
line - the line number (int)
file - the file which the line is contained in (String)
Returns:
the average percent, between 0.0 and 1.0, -1.0f if the line does not belong to any mutants

zoomOut

public void zoomOut(edu.uci.ics.jung.visualization.VisualizationViewer<temp.MyVertex,temp.MyEdge> canvas)
Zooms the graph out

Parameters:
canvas - The canvas to be zoomed

zooms the graph in

Parameters:
canvas - The canvas to be zoomed

public void addRadioButtonUpdateTransformerListener(javax.swing.JRadioButton button)
Adds and ActionListener to the JRadioButton's that control node/source color. This ActionListener updates all transformers, and redisplays the source

loadButtonListener

public void loadButtonListener()
TODO fix Action Listener method for the load button. Loads the location of all the nodes. DOES NOT check to see if the file is correct. Use at your own risk. (Only use it if you know the file you are loading is for your data)

createPopupMenu

public javax.swing.JMenu createPopupMenu(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e,
                                         int index)
Creates a popup menu when the right mouse button is clicked on a vertex or an edge. Also makes the vertex label text blue when it is clicked, and switches the label text back to black when the popup menu is destroyed. Written entirely by me.

Parameters:
e - The mouse event
pickedVertexState - Whether the vertex is highlight or not
